examples: Sleep well and sweet dreams.
I slept like a log until morning.
I usually sleep like a baby.
I didn't sleep a wink last night.
I usually sleep for eight hours every night.
words.defineEn: to rest our mind and body, with our eyes closed
words.defineVi: để tâm trí và cơ thể của chúng ta nghỉ ngơi, với đôi mắt nhắm lại

examples: She looked up from her work and gave a yawn.
He let out a yawn, his mouth wide open.
Can you really catch a yawn from someone else?
That is a lot of yawns, Squeaks!
Some people yawned a lot over multiple sessions, and others never opened their mouths at all.
words.defineEn: to unexpectedly open one's mouth wide and deeply breathe in because of being bored or tired
words.defineVi: bất ngờ mở to miệng và hít vào thật sâu vì buồn chán hoặc mệt mỏi

examples: I usually take a nap after lunch.
I laid the baby down on the soft carpet for a nap.
The sofa provides a great place to take an afternoon nap.
The living room had a comfortable sofa where she took afternoon naps.
Catching your opponent napping can turn the game in your favor.
words.defineEn: to sleep and rest for a short amount of time, particularly during the day
words.defineVi: ngủ và nghỉ ngơi trong một khoảng thời gian ngắn, đặc biệt là vào ban ngày

examples: Rise and shine, sleepy head!
How Loco Works changed Horwich from sleepy village to a hive of industry.
Remember (that) you may feel sleepy after taking the pills.
- Scientists are sleepy people.
Scientists are sleepy people.
words.defineEn: feeling the need to sleep
words.defineVi: cảm thấy cần phải ngủ

examples: Newborns are capable of sweating, snoring, and sneezing, but they can't shiver.
Enlarged uvulas are also found in people who snore or suffer from obstructive sleep apnea, where sleep is interrupted by parts of the throat cutting off airflow at night.
No, (Andy snoring)
(Andy snoring)
(Andy snoring)
words.defineEn: to breathe through one's nose and mouth in a noisy way while asleep
words.defineVi: thở bằng mũi và miệng một cách ồn ào khi ngủ

examples: The old woman knitted blankets for her grandchildren.
The trees were covered in a blanket of snowy white.
We sat on a blanket in the park, enjoying fava bean and herb-filled wraps.
We sat around the picnic blanket, passing a bowl of filberts, enjoying their crunchy texture.
He's kicking his feet up onto the blankets, not even bothering to take off his shoes.
words.defineEn: a large piece of fabric made of wool, cotton, or other materials that is used to keep warm or to provide comfort, used on beds, sofas, chairs, etc.
words.defineVi: một mảnh vải lớn làm bằng len, bông hoặc các vật liệu khác được sử dụng để giữ ấm hoặc tạo sự thoải mái, được sử dụng trên giường, ghế sofa, ghế, v.v.

examples: He produced a sheet of paper from his pocket.
All newspapers sang from the same song sheet.
After the surgery, his face was as white as a sheet.
Sushi rolls are often wrapped in sheets of edible algae, known as nori.
They want the cabinet all singing from the same hymn sheet.
words.defineEn: a large, thin, and rectangular piece of cloth that is spread on a bed to lie under or on top of it
words.defineVi: một mảnh vải lớn, mỏng và hình chữ nhật được trải trên giường để nằm bên dưới hoặc bên trên nó

examples: The children had pillow fights during their sleepover.
My motrher decorated her room with new curtains and pillows.
As they say, a clean conscience makes a soft pillow.
Sarah used to cuddle her pillow for comfort and relaxation.
As the proverb goes, an honest man's pillow is his peace of mind.
words.defineEn: a cloth bag stuffed with soft materials that we put our head on when we are lying or sleeping
words.defineVi: một túi vải nhồi bằng vật liệu mềm mà chúng ta gối đầu khi nằm hoặc ngủ

examples: And an eiderdown double duvet could cost you over $8,000.
The majority of the eiderdown that King Eider produces is sold as is for companies to use in their products, but it also sells its own pillows and duvets.

Friðriksdóttir: 1970, there were laws in Iceland that we must certify all eiderdown that is sold, and also when we are making some products, like duvets or pillows or some garments, we must book a time with the inspector, and he must check the quality and the weight before we fill the product.
words.defineEn: a cover for one's bed that is made of two layers of cloth and is filled with feathers, cotton, or other soft materials
words.defineVi: một tấm trải giường được làm bằng hai lớp vải và chứa đầy lông vũ, bông hoặc các vật liệu mềm khác

examples: Some people have insomnia.
I stands for insomnia.
Familial fatal insomnia usually affects adults as early as their 30s, though there have been a very small number of cases in teenagers.
This seemingly unsolvable loop is at the heart of insomnia, the world’s most common sleep disorder.
And I ended up with, like, really bad insomnia.
words.defineEn: a disorder in which one is unable to sleep or stay asleep
words.defineVi: một rối loạn trong đó một người không thể ngủ hoặc ngủ

examples: Sleep eating and sleeping pills.
It's very much like a sleeping pill.
And over-the-counter sleeping pills can be highly addictive, leading to withdrawal that worsens symptoms.
After she was told that she couldn't come to work because of the complaint that she filed, she took all of her sleeping pills.
Placebo sleeping pills work best if they’re blue, red placebos are better as stimulants or pain relievers, and yellow placebos make better antidepressants.
words.defineEn: a soporific drug taken as a tablet or capsule
words.defineVi: một loại thuốc ngủ được dùng dưới dạng viên nén hoặc viên nang

words.defineEn: someone whose sleep is easily disturbed
words.defineVi: một người có giấc ngủ dễ bị quấy rầy

words.defineEn: to no longer be awake, and so, be sleeping
words.defineVi: không còn thức nữa, và vì vậy, đang ngủ

words.defineEn: very deep in sleep and difficult to be woken up
words.defineVi: ngủ rất sâu và khó đánh thức

examples: She’s just a nightmare dressed like a daydream.
The shows lifted my spirits and reminded me that this nightmare would soon be over.
This reminded him of when his father sang him to sleep as a child after a nightmare.
So how do you warn them about stranger danger without giving them nightmares?
So you give nightmares
words.defineEn: a very scary, unpleasant, or disturbing dream
words.defineVi: một giấc mơ rất đáng sợ, khó chịu hoặc đáng lo ngại

examples: With atypical depression, you oversleep.

Depressed mood most of the day, diminished interests like we've talked about before in the 'Six Signs of Depression' anhedonia, not being interested in pleasurable activities or activities that used to be pleasurable to you are no longer pleasurable, you may lose weight, you may gain weight, you may oversleep, you may not sleep enough, you may feel fatigued and have body aches.
words.defineEn: to wake up later than one intended to
words.defineVi: thức dậy muộn hơn dự định

examples: That DJ's voice really sets my teeth on edge.
The surgeon set her broken arm.
The scheme sets a precedent for other companies.
International companies set the price of oil.
His time in the 25-meter freestyle set a national record.
words.defineEn: to prepare something in a way that is ready or suitable for use
words.defineVi: để chuẩn bị một cái gì đó trong một cách đã sẵn sàng hoặc phù hợp để sử dụng

examples: Set the alarm for 7 o'clock.
He set the alarm for 7 a.m.
This should ring alarm bells in all European countries and the United States.
The fire alarm went off, and we evacuated the building.
The assassination set alarm bells ringing in Washington and European capitals.
words.defineEn: a clock that makes a sound at a set time, used to wake up someone
words.defineVi: một chiếc đồng hồ phát ra âm thanh vào một thời điểm nhất định, được sử dụng để đánh thức ai đó

words.defineEn: to sleep in a way that one cannot be easily woken up
words.defineVi: ngủ theo cách mà người ta không thể dễ dàng đánh thức

examples: What, are you sleepwalking or something?
So number one would be having a history of sleepwalking.
In the award-winning movie Sleepwalk with Me, based on the one-man show of the same name, comedian Mike Birbiglia describes the hilarious and often startling things his body does when he’s sleeping.
And sleepwalking is something that we see more in children, but adults can do it as well.
If you and I don't stand up for our rights to privacy now, we will find ourselves sleepwalking into mass surveillance.
words.defineEn: to walk or do other actions while one is sleeping
words.defineVi: đi bộ hoặc làm các hành động khác trong khi một người đang ngủ

examples: I was having difficulty in staying awake.
After a quick run in the park, I felt more awake and energized, ready to tackle the rest of my day.
After attending the seminar on mental health, I became awake to the stigma surrounding mental illness and decided to become an advocate for greater awareness and understanding.
But before long, I knew I had nurtured a snake in my bosom, as I awoke one morning to find myself robbed blind!
I stayed awake.
words.defineEn: not in a state of sleep or unconsciousness
words.defineVi: không ở trạng thái ngủ hoặc bất tỉnh
